entry.title: SOU faculty members take lead role in open textbook project
entry.summary: (Ashland, Ore.) — Open Oregon Educational Resources, a statewide initiative that promotes textbook affordability for students at Oregon colleges and universities, is releasing four new open textbooks whose authors include four Southern Oregon University faculty members and a student in the Criminology and Criminal Justice program. “Our goal with these projects is to provide rigorous… The post SOU faculty members take lead role in open textbook project appeared first on Southern Oregon Business Journal.

entry.title: The Agriculture Industry in Southern Oregon: A Risk Management Perspective
entry.summary: By Paul Quandt Southern Oregon’s agriculture sector, renowned for its diverse crops such as wine grapes, pears and specialty produce, is facing a complex landscape during 2025. Farmers and agribusinesses must navigate a confluence of challenges, including climate variability, shifting trade policies, labor constraints and escalating insurance costs. Adopting a proactive risk management approach is… The post The Agriculture Industry in Southern Oregon: A Risk Management Perspective appeared first on Southern Oregon Business Journal.

entry.title: Bend MSA Adds Two Counties
entry.summary: by David Cooke and Nicole Ramos, State of Oregon Employment Department March 11, 2025 The Bend Metropolitan Statistical Area (MSA) is now three counties: Crook County, Deschutes County, and Jefferson County. Previously the Bend-Redmond MSA included only one county: Deschutes County. Also, the old name for the MSA was “Bend-Redmond, OR MSA”. The title was shortened based on… The post Bend MSA Adds Two Counties appeared first on Southern Oregon Business Journal.

entry.title: Oregon’s Part-Time Workers: More than One-Fifth of Employment in 2024
entry.summary: by Henry Fields, Workforce Analyst, Oregon Employment Department May 20, 2025 Although most people work in full-time jobs, around 23% of employed Oregonians regularly worked part-time schedules in 2024. People work part time for a variety of reasons. Part-time jobs offer flexibility for some who seek a job that fits their circumstances, such as students, those… The post Oregon’s Part-Time Workers: More than One-Fifth of Employment in 2024 appeared first on Southern Oregon Business Journal.

entry.title: Roseburg Set to See Hottest Day of 2025 So Far Today
entry.summary: Roseburg is expected to hit near 90 degrees Friday - making it the hottest day of 2025 so far. The National Weather Service says highs will be 15 - 20 degrees above normal. A gradual cooldown is expected over the weekend.
